summary: Hypopharyngeal cancer is a rare type of head and neck cancer that originates in the hypopharynx, the area where the larynx and esophagus meet. It forms in the outer layer (epithelium) of the hypopharynx and can spread into deeper tissues. Due to its location and often late diagnosis, it has a high mortality rate.
causes: Bile acids causing inflammation and DNA damage
symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes in the neck
Sore throat in one location that persists
Pain radiating from the throat to the ears
diagnosis: Physical examination (checking lymph nodes, throat inspection)
